intro: Scorzonera pinnatifida, commonly known as the common scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with a central disk, typically blooming in summer. Scorzonera pinnatifida is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. It has been used historically in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
